results.description:
Not only is Zurich one of the best places in the world to live, but it's also a great place to start a business. With its top-tier educational institutions, robust infrastructure, and business friendly administration, in many ways Zurich is the ideal place to launch a startup. There is a wealth of creative energy and entrepreneurial spirit in this area, but this sometimes gets lost in the perception that Zurich is simply a "banking town". Also, while there has long been an entrepreneurial scene here, it is somewhat of an exclusive club, and it can be particularly intimidating to non-locals, or aspiring entrepreneurs who want to learn the ropes before jumping in completely.

We can change that! The goal of this group is to open up the entrepreneurial community, giving people a friendly and casual way to network, share ideas, and help each other succeed. There is no pressure or prejudice here, just a group of people who share a belief in the power of free enterprise, and who enjoy having a good chat with like-minded others.

So whether you are a seasoned entrepreneur, a student who is considering what to do next, or just someone who wants to take the path less traveled, come join us! Whether you want to start the next Google, or just make a living being self-employed, or anything in between, come join us! Investors and service providers are also welcome, as long as there is no overt solication.

We normally meet in the evening of the third Wednesday of each month. In addition, smaller morning gatherings take place on Tuesday mornings. Locations vary, so watch for your email invitation and check the details carefully.

We hope to see you at the next meetup!
results.name: The Zurich Entrepreneur Meetup Group

results.description:
Welcome to the Meetup Hike & Outdoor Group!!!

As seen on this picture, Switzerland is a hiking paradise, as its trails almost covers the whole country...but there is more to see: majestic mountains, beautiful lakes and evergreen fields, just to mention few things. Since 2007 we have been organizing many, many hikes and other outdoor activities throughout the year. In Summer we do mostly hiking, but also Rafting, Canyoning, Biking, Inline Skating and Climbing (Vía Ferrata). In Winter, we concentrate on Cross Country Skiing, Sledging (Sledding), Ice Skating, Tourenskiing and Snowshoeing, as well as the traditional Alpine Skiing.

We are an international group, from people coming from all over the world ranging from Australia all the way to the Americas. Our events are designed for everyone to participate, from beginners to advanced hikers.

If you are someone seeking to get to know the hiking paradise of Switzerland, do some exercise on the weekend and to get to know some really cool people, you came to the right place.

So get up from that couch you have been sitting all this time and join us to enjoy together what Switzerland has to offer in nature and beauty.

See you then!

Sven and the organizer team
results.name: Zurich Hike & Outdoor

results.description:
Welcome to Züri eXpats Zunft (ZEZ) Associaton on Meetup.com, in this group our English speaking City Life Network/ Worldwide people activities are announced

We are a "Verein nach atikel 60 im Schweizer Gesetz"; an Association, with member fees to finance our activites for our members, we are a non profit organisation, (all our organisers and volunteers are getting a drink per our, or the equal amount to that). The anual basic member fee is for 2013/14 Sfr50 or €40.

Zurich expats Zunft verein Post finance altstetterstr 311 8047 Zurich

IBAN (Bei elektr. Erfassung) CH5609000000606598532 IBAN (Bei Druck auf Papier) CH56 0900 0000 6065 9853 2

We are organised as a round table/rotary club/business club. Our members network is international and local well connected(LinkedIn). The senior members help the new members to get integrated and orientated in CH, during courses and meetings at our allied companies

Young, well-educated Internationals, let's socialize!

We help you get settled in Switzerland and tackle the first hurdles. We define you as a digital native, aged 17-45. You have international experience, having already lived in different countries. You are typically single and independent.


What's in it for you?

    As a paid member you get reductions on course fees and more, which in price AND quality can’t be beat in Switzerland (such as certified German lessons to improve your experience of Zurich and be aware of what’s going on)

    Spend less on living arrangements: reduce your security deposit when renting

    Be a VIP: discounts on entrance fees, VIP lounges, etc.

    Pay for one group and get four: Sign up for one Züri eXpat group and get automatic membership to three others. Plus LinkedIn and Facebook

    Züri eXpats is a Swiss association according to paragraph 60 of the Swiss civil code, and due to our statutes you become a member by joining. A membership fee is assessed after a free trial period (please request a copy of our regulations)

 

For all who made it till here – thank you for reading. Please get to know your peer members and integrate in this wonderful expat ecosystem of Zurich and its region.

Who are YOU anyway?

You are probably a needed Ausländer in Switzerland, whose productivity helps the Swiss economy maintain its high international standards. Here’s why;

 

The Swiss economy needs qualified human resources to keep the wheels turning to keep wealth and health at a sustainable level;

There is a shortage of human resources; intellectual capital is needed and without expats the economy would collapse;

There are simply not enough Swiss available to do all available highly skilled jobs, or who could be trained to do so in the future;

Head hunters search globally for highly skilled international professionals, providing this expertise to Zurich and its region in service to Swiss society.

 

 

 

Let's celebrate Zurich City Life; we know where to socialize as expats in Switzerland.


After work drinks on Thursdays at Bellevue;

Friday pub nights @a English Pub; from women’s round table to sports events… plus much more;

Bellevue Saturdays @ downtown venues; come meet your English-speaking peers;

And the various National Days are not forgotten.

 

 

 

Zurich is an outstanding place. Besides its city center teeming with clubs and restaurants, it’s also celebrated for its quality of life.


Zurich is situated on the shores of a lake with clear and pure water, and is surrounded by hills and scenic mountains.

Now, if you want to socialize with your peers and feel at home and enjoy life…

 

 

Then the Züri eXpats Meetup Group is for YOU

We use many social media channels to spread our message, such as: LinkedIn, Facebook, and Meetup.

Züri eXpats was formed to address this ongoing challenge. As reported by Rundschau on Swiss channel SF1 on February 26, 2013, we have a positive impact and work with the authorities to build better relationships and trust.

Our experiences were profiled in the hit play Expats (2013) at Neumarkt theater.

 

We are alive and kicking... Here is a summary of our activities.

This past year we organized a variety of professional, social, and cultural meetups, also planning numerous social gatherings around international highlights in Zurich. We did over 240 events in and around Zurich, and all over Switzerland.

Our highly qualified fellow expat City Life members will be there for:

◉ Drinks & socializing: Be with your peers and enjoy life in Zurich.
◉ Events on the Lake/ Limmat river, and BBQs: there’s no better way to celebrate summer.
◉ Street Parade/ Pop and jazz concerts: We know what’s on and can get the best prices.
◉ Bahnhofstrasse shopping: Ladies , we have insight on how to get invitations to all the great shows.
◉ Summer neighborhood parties: What’s happening outside your door? They’re having a party.

From basic to advanced, from general to sector related… Just bring an idea for an event!

 

We do a lot with our four Meetup groups: Züri eXpats City Life Network, Züri eXpats Business Professionals, Züri eXpats Hike & Outdoor Sandbox, and s. Altogether we have over 3000 highly educated members that contribute to 60% of the economic output of the Canton of Zurich.

Züri eXpats also participates in social and semi-political events that help contribute awareness and promote integration of eXpats in Zurich. We contribute positively to the Swiss lifestyle as well, and work in cooperation with our partners in the integration offices at both the city and cantonal level.

We look forward to meeting you at one of our upcoming events, to attend and contribute to the experience…whether you are Swiss or an Ausländer.


Sincerely,

John Wubbe

President of Züri eXpats

For those interested in organizing, or would like further information, please call 079 946 38 43 or jpmwubbe@gmail.com. You can contact me for advice, ideas, or suggestions.
results.name: Socialising English speaking Zuri eXpats Zunft (ZeZ)

results.description:
Find fun, trail, and friendship in Winterthur andSchaffhausen.

The Hash House Harriers is a more social version of Hare and Hounds, where you join the pack of hounds (runners and walkers) to chase down the trail set by the hare or hares (other runners or walkers), then gather together for a bit of social activity known as the On After, where we visit a local restaurant for refreshment, humorous camaraderie, and food.

All are welcome, young and old, fast or slow, so don't wait to get in shape, just come on out and join us.

The only prerequisite to hashing is a sense of humor.

We meet every third Saturday of the month. The meeting point differs in the Schaffhausen area, usually easily acessible by public transport.

See also our web site: www.schaffhausen-h3.com

To cover the costs for the beverages at stops and at the circle, as well as the management costs, like web site etc. we introduced an individual contribution of 5 CHF per run per adult.

    Züri eXpats is a Swiss association according to paragraph 60 of the Swiss civil code, and due to our statutes you become a member by joining. A membership fee is assessed after a free trial period (please request a copy of our regulations).

For all who made it till here – thank you for reading. Please get to know your peer members and integrate in this wonderful expat ecosystem of Zurich and its region.

Who are YOU anyway?

You are probably a needed Ausländer in Switzerland, whose productivity helps the Swiss economy maintain its high international standards. Here’s why;

 

The Swiss economy needs qualified human resources to keep the wheels turning to keep wealth and health at a sustainable level;


There is a shortage of human resources; intellectual capital is needed and without expats the economy would collapse;

 

There are simply not enough Swiss available to do all available highly skilled jobs, or who could be trained to do so in the future;

Head hunters search globally for highly skilled international professionals, providing this expertise to Zurich and its region in service to Swiss society.


"the expat life cycle."

First phase of the expat life cycle

Residence permits/visas: regulations for EU- and Non-EU-citizens, differences between permits and an explanation of Swiss immigration rules;


Apartments, housing: better ways to find accommodations, and how to apply for them; what to do in the event of defects, noise disturbance, and disputes with neighbors;


Finance / banking: how to manage your money in the Swiss banking system;

 

Health / insurance systems: how insurance works in Switzerland, from health to other kinds of insurance; what are the available choices.



Second phase of the expat life cycle

Taxes / “1st-2nd-3rd-Säule” insurance system: how the Swiss residence permit system works in Switzerland (A, B, C) and what the available choices are. How does the tax system work here and what about my pension? What do I need to know to start a business?

 

German courses: from basic to advanced, from general to sector-related German classes: how to find a course that fits your needs;

Finance: how to manage your money in the Swiss banking system;


Getting rid of stuff: throwing out rubbish costs money here; how this works in Switzerland and what are the available choices.



Third phase of the expat life cycle


Swiss integration on a higher level: take weekend courses in the Swiss alps on management from top Swiss educators;


Swiss housing rules: what did I do wrong now? Get informed about the rules of the house;


 

Education for the children: international or local? What are the possibilities for the future? Bilingual or international school? What about a boarding school?

Import your car: There a few things to look into before you do this. Please contact us; we can help you with tips before mistakes are made.

 

Fourth phase of the expat life cycle

Obtain a Swiss driver's license: Getting a driver's license is straightforward, yet there are a few things to know beforehand, so please contact us. We can help avoid mistakes;


 

Business networking: get to meet and know like-minded business professionals and entrepreneurs in Zurich;


Integrate and become a Swiss citizen: we can help you to prepare, and we provide all the details and steps to support your choices.


 

Or you leave again for your next assignment because of a better offer. Another expat life cycle begins. Our group is mainly build around the expats that stayed, but see no ad on to become SWISS citizen by ID but feel SWISS citizen by their efforts they gave to the SWISS society


What the Zuri eXpats Meetup Group does for YOU

 

We use many social media channels to spread our message, such as: LinkedIn, Facebook, and Meetup.

Züri eXpats was formed to address this ongoing challenge. As reported by Rundschau on Swiss channel SF1 on February 26, 2013, we have a positive impact and work with the authorities to build better relationships and trust.

Our experiences were profiled in the hit play Expats (2013) at Neumarkt theater.

 

We help you to help yourself, and we change perceptions about expats.

Looking to the end of 2013 and beyond, what types of events shall we focus on?

This past year we organized a variety of professional, social, and cultural meetups, also planning numerous social gatherings around international highlights in Zurich. We organise per ani over 240 events in and around Zurich, and all over Switzerland.

Our highly qualified fellow Züri eXpats members help us

We do a lot with our four Meetup groups: Züri eXpats City Life Network, Züri eXpats Business Professionals, Züri eXpats Hike & Outdoor Sandbox, and Zurich Movie Fans. Altogether we have over 3000 highly educated members that contribute to 60% of the economic output of the Canton of Zurich.

Züri eXpats also participates in social and semi-political events that help spread awareness and promote integration of expats in Zurich. We contribute positively to the Swiss lifestyle as well, and work in cooperation with our partners in the integration offices at both the city and cantonal level.

We look forward to meeting you at one of our upcoming events, to attend and contribute to the experience…whether you are Swiss or an Ausländer.

We NEED YOU; as a volunteer/sponsor

But first you try out our FREE events

We’ve set ambitious goals to organize more activities & VIP venues for our members this year. It is our intention to have a full range of events throughout the week that cater to everyone's interests.

To accomplish this we need support, so if you become a volunteer and help us organize up to five events, you will become a Premium Member for the year, and be invited to be a member of ALL FOUR Züri eXpat groups. If you are too busy then you can support us with €40 per annum as a member of all four groups. We need your support for the activities, so please sign up as volunteer today and don’t forget to RSVP for tonight’s event.

We have an international staff of energetic and enthusiastic volunteers that will make you feel welcome at ALL of our events.

results.description:
The Hash House Harriers are an International Group founded in 1938 with over 70,000 active worldwide members. We are a social running (we have a lot of walkers as well!) group that focuses on on the social element rather than just running. This is why we also welcome slow runners, power walkers and other walkers.

We meet regularly at weekends (once a month) and every Thursday. Anybody can join by showing up at the designated meeting point of the day.

Our aim is to bring together local Swiss people and expats who want to socialize and have a bit of exercise at the same time. It's a great forum to meet new friends and potentially travel internationally as we have a large number of International Events.

Members come in all shapes & sizes, races, ages and fitness levels. We cater for young and old, fast or slow, fit or 'not-so-fit'! The main prerequisites are a sense of humor, willingness to meet new people,open-mindedness, tolerance and a general sense of fun. We are mainly English-speaking but most of us can speak (some) German..Most of our Swiss members are fluent in about 4 languages!

More information can be found on our main site www.zh3.ch and on the Meetup information page.

The planned future events are on Meetup and our main site. We also have organisers ('hares') lined up for some weeks ahead. If you would like to see who will organise in future, or would like to see free dates when you could set a trail, you can check the hareline. If you'd like more information on how to set trails see the hares guide under More / Files.
results.name: The Zürich Hash House Harriers (ZH3)

results.description: Hop aboard a culinary tour of Zurich, from cheap and cheerful to fine and decadent restaurants. We are the perfect combination of friends, fun and food with more than a heavy sprinkling of laughter. Our 'tour' will include indulgent brunches to 'wasting'  the afternoon away with conversation,  cakes, tea and coffee (with maybe a little champagne thrown in).   But...STOP PRESS... one things for sure... it will be absolutely packed full of restaurants..! So if you want to put a 'red hot chilli 'kick into your winter evenings, drop the takeaway, switch off the tv and discover new restaurants, new friends and a great social experience with no washing up at the end of the evening...guaranteed! Open to any age, single/married/divorced men and women. We all need to eat - so why not make friends and have fun at the same time.
results.name: ZURICH'S EATING CLUB

results.description: If you are looking to expand your social circle and make the most out of living in Zurich then you should come and join us. We meet regularly to share a few drinks, have a chat and have a good time.  This group is about meeting new and interesting people in an informal and friendly environment - away from the crowds.  Come on your own or with friends - its up to you - but you will always be made to feel welcome!
results.name: Zurich Socialising

results.description: Every time I go to a classical music concert here in Zurich I have the impression that I am bringing the average age down by half! I know I am not alone :-). There is no reason this should be the case! Let's go to great concerts, have fun together and turn these odds around! The group is Zurich based and aims largely at the Tonhalle, The Opernhaus and the KKL in Luzern. We try to keep the spontaneity to a maximum. The way it works for the tickets is like this: - we pick a section of the concert hall that has enough free places and cheap tickets to seat all of us - you then book the tickets online; usually the sites are either opernhaus.ch or tonhalle.ch.
results.name: Go classical !

results.description:
Happiness is a state of mind or feeling characterized by contentment, satisfaction, pleasure, or joy. Happiness comes from deep within, and not from people, situations, or circumstances.

According to Researchers from Harvard Medical School and the University of California, San Diego:

“When an individual becomes happy, the network effect can be measured up to three degrees. One person’s happiness triggers a chain reaction that benefits not only his friends, but his friends’ friends, and his friends’ friends’ friends. The effect lasts for up to one year.”

Since whatever we focus on grows, the aim of this group is to help members focus on happiness and to spread it at every opportunity.

If you are a happy person and want to socialize and network with other happy people, this is for you. If your goal is to become a happier person this group is for you. If you want to contaminate others with your happiness, this group is definitely for you. Visit http://iamhappyproject.org for more information; while you are there please follow us on twitter and like us on Facebook.

results.description:
Mountain Bike, Road Bike, Ski & Snowboard Adventures in the Swiss Alps

Swiss Alpine Adventure is not your average cycling/outdoor sports club. We have taken the traditional cycling club philosophy and broken the mould. Our community is not about performance, race results or proving yourself to anyone. It’s not about being the first to the top of a climb or being the fastest down a trail, it’s about sharing the childhood wonderment we all once had when we learned how to turn the pedals on our first bike.

For many of us bikes gave us our first taste of independence and gave us the freedom to explore our own neighbourhood. It’s exactly this sense of adventure we want our members to find again, to wake up the inner child and ask the question what is on the other side of that hill or around the next corner.

Swiss Alpine Adventure is about “Enjoying the Ride” and sharing it with friends rather than trying to prove anything in terms of fitness or performance. On any ride our main philosophies are that no-one gets left behind, rides are at a sociable pace and the aim is to have everyone finish the day with a smile on their face.

Over the years Swiss Alpine Adventure has grown and in winter we are now every bit as much about skiing and snowboarding as we are about cycling in summer. In recent winters we have organised avalanche safety training for both beginners and more experienced back country travelers as well as a number of freeride and touring weekends. Once again the focus is on the participation and enjoyment rather than the performance. For winter 2014/2015 we are also looking into organising a few events for beginner/intermediate skiers and snowboarders who are taking their first steps or perfecting their technique in an on-piste environment.

With over 1700 active Swiss resident cyclists and outdoor-sports lovers, we are probably biggest and most active cycling and outdoor-sports community in Switzerland and organise adventures countrywide. You would certainly be hard pushed to find a more enthusiastic community of outdoor sports lovers anywhere in the country.

The group is very much about inclusion and we want to help as many people as possible see why Switzerland is such a great country for outdoor sports. While we are based in the German Speaking part of Switzerland our members are situated throughout the country and we regularly organise events to different locations. If there are not enough events in your area why not drop us a line and lets see if we can help you get an active Swiss Alpine Adventure community going in your area.

The calendar is fairly packed with many different kinds of events and there are are always more getting added. There really should be something to suit everyone's two wheeled (or wintersports) tastes. If you feel something is missing then contact us and we'll either try to arrange it or help you get it set up through this group yourself.

Over the course of the year most of our events, tours, after-work rides and get-togethers are totally free and run by the community for the community. Our workshops, courses and weekends away will have an associated cost.

The community is completely self financed with a large chunk of the money directly coming out of the head organisers pocket, if you would like to support our group in any way feel free to get in touch. 

For the most up-to-date news on what we are up to check out our Facebook page and click on the "like" button. If you'd like ideas for mountain bike tours check out our website. Why not take a look at our video or photo pages to get an idea of what we like to get up to.

Obwohl die Hauptsprache unsere Gruppe Englisch ist, sprechen wir auch gerne Deutsch.
results.name: Swiss Alpine Adventure

results.description:
Are you a sailor, land-locked in Switzerland, and want to get onto the water?  To cruise the Med, or perhaps further afield?

Join us in the activities of "Sailing New Horizons" meet-up group.

We aim to facilitate the ways and means to make cost-effective and fun sailing get-aways.

Possible sailing destinations to start: the Ionian Islands, off northern Greece; Corfu, Ithaca and Cephalonia in the north waters, or perhaps Peloponnese peninsula and the Saronic Gulf in the south.   Or consider the Croatian coastline between Pula and Korcula, and the waters off Turkey's Gulf of Fethiye and Datça Peninsula.  Looking west to the relatively placid waters around Majorca, the Costa Smeralda and the offshore islands of north-east Sardinia, northern Sicily and the Cote d'Azur.

For more experienced sailors: the two Greek island groups of the Cycladese (notably Mykonos and Santorini) and the Dodecanese (Rhodes and Kos) - these lie in the path of the Meltemi wind that blows from the Balkans, so things get fresh.  Other challenging but exhilarating sailing areas can also be found off the smaller, less accessible Balearic Islands; the barren, beautiful 100-island archipelago of Kornati in Croatia; Elba and the "Seven Sisters" group of islands between Tuscany and Corsica, and off the eastern coast of Spain.

What are your suggestions?
results.name: Sailing New Horizons

results.description:
urban mindfulness meditation zurich offers a variety of educational and practical classes, workshops and courses designed to help you manage stress and to increase your health and well-being.

All courses are grounded in brain science, positive psychology and contemplative training and teach meditation in a secular, non-religious manner.

The purpose of this group is to create a warm, safe and trustful space where we learn, exchange ideas, meditate, reflect and explore life's questions. We are a fast growing community of people interested in cultivating happiness, peace and wisdom in our daily lives.

Events:

Tuesday evening drop in classes: * Each Tuesday of the month has a different focus and content, as following:

1st Tuesday- Mindfulness Meditation made easy. 60min class. Introduction followed by short practices and exercises in mindfulness (such as Mindfulness of breathing). All levels.

2nd Tuesday - Deep Dive Mindfulness Meditation. 60min class. Short introduction followed by a longer practice (45min). We practice Mindfulness Meditations, such as Body Scan, Sitting Meditation, Mindfulness of Breathing. All levels.

3rd Tuesday - Feel calm with Breathing exercises /Pranayama, 60min class. Short introduction followed by breathing exercises that bring clarity, focus and peace of mind. All levels.

4th Tuesday  - Practice Compassion, Kindness, Gratitude, 60min class. Short introduction, followed by a combination of mindfulness practices with reflections and exercises in Compassion, Gratitude, Kindness, Generosity and other ethical values. All levels.

*In the absence of the organizer (Ela) the classes are held by the co-organizer (Martin).

Tuesday classes cost 20chf / session.

Other Workshops and courses, events organized by mindful brain or special guests:

MBSR course, Urban Silent Retreat, Self-Compassion workshop, Mindful Eating, Meditation for Beginners, Calming your anxious mind...

Thank you for joining us! Looking forward to connect and interact with you in one of our classes or events!

Organizer: My name is Ela Amarie and I am a psychologist, a certified meditation teacher and an MBSR (Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction) trainer, certified by the Swiss Mindfulness Association.

More about my work and other projects:

http://www.themindfulbrain.net/

You can try 3 free audio guided meditations:

http://www.themindfulbrain.net/free-audio-m...

Like us on facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/mindfulbrain


About Mindfulness
Mindfulness is an integrative, mind-body approach to life that helps people relate effectively to their experience. It involves paying attention to our own subjective thoughts, feelings and body sensations, in a way that can increase awareness, help us manage difficult experience and increase space to make wise choices. Recently this approach entered into the mainstream culture. A “Google” search on “mindfulness” results in millions of hits, and mindfulness based therapies are growing in popularity, with teachers and programs all around the globe.

results.description:
Welcome to this Meetup Group dedicated to HYPNOSIS, a way to communicate ideas in an effective way to help transformation happen in our life.

So, if you are interested in :

- improving your mental and body health

- communication (including self-talk)

- increasing your self-awareness and live more relaxed

- changing habits and discovering new ways of thinking, feeling and doing

- and much more

Just join this group! Contemporary hypnosis as well as NLP are greatly influenced by Milton Erickson, one among the greatest communicators of the 20th century. if you are curious to discover the world of hypnotic communication, just join one of our events, everyone is welcome.

If you want to know more first and are wondering whether hypnosis is for you, the following description may be helpful: hypnosis helps to alleviate physical and mental pain, as well as support us in the realisation of our objectives if we have experienced difficulties. It can also help us realise the dreams we wish to make manifest in our lives.

Therapeutic hypnosis evolved over time and has nothing to do with losing control of oneself and being programmed by an external person. Hypnosis is practiced with great respect for the personal freedom of the client and takes place in a climate of openness and curiosity. Contrary to expectations, when we are in a state of trance we do not lose control of ourselves: we master our consciousness, our spirit and our bodies in a different way.The aim is CHANGE as well as exploring ways in which we can liberate ourselves from the obstacles that are in our way and to find paths to help us reconnect to their our resources, feel more relaxed and confident in ourself and in their future. When we are trapped in life, we become incapable of knowing what to do to live more comfortably, since the solutions that we are capable of imagining are few and very imperfect. Hypnotic trance can be qualified as ‘generative’, because it brings relaxation and curiosity, a secure space and an absence of judgement which permits us to imagine new possibilities, new perspectives and ways of feeling which we could hardly even dream of in a state of stress or hopelessness. It is never too late for us to create a happy life for ourselves.  

 History

Humans have used hypnosis for over 3000 years. The ways in which it is used varies from culture to culture, but the principles remain very similar. I practice Ericksonian hypnosis, which differs from the older “classical hypnosis”, because it does not aim to ‘re-programme’ the client, but offers a way to accompany him or her in his or her discovery of new perspectives.

 

The conscious and subconscious mind

The subconscious mind is at the centre of the hypnotherapeutic process. It is the location of a number of our bodily, mental and spiritual resources. Our conscious mind can, amongst other things, think rationally and make decisions. Our subconscious has numerous capacities that we have not had to make an effort to acquire voluntarily: our immune system protects us automatically, our breathing works naturally all day and our cells regenerate without having to be asked to do so. Other faculties can be learned voluntarily and later become subconscious, such as speaking, standing upright, walking as well as our way of seeing the world, our way of seeing our own selves and the way in which we relate to others. Hypnotherapy consists of introducing hypnosis and of using this state to learn by indirect communication. We often already know what it is we want to change, but our habitual thought, feelings and emotions impede us from fully integrating this knowledge. We must therefore above all work on evolving our emotional relationship to the world around us.

 

Of course hypnotherapy has its limitations: it is a highly useful complementary therapy, but in no way does it replace medical, psychiatric or psychotherapeutic treatment, above all in cases of severe health problems.

 

Areas of application  

The areas in which hypnotherapy can be used are:

  •  Changing behaviour patterns

  •  

    Changing thought patterns
  • Increasing self-confidence
  • Weight loss
  • Chronic pain
  • Negative habits
  • Stress and anxiety
  • Phobias
  • Hypertension
  • Skin problems
  • Asthma
  • Allergies
  • Fibromyalgia
  • Sleep problems
  • Burn-out
  • Depression 
  • Auto-immune diseases
  • Sexual problems
  • Personal efficacy
  • Improvement of concentration and learning abilities
  • Birth preparation
  • Personal development
  • Development of creativity

 

Milton Erickson

In Ericksonian thought there exists a conviction that at each moment we act in the best way we can, using the resources we have at our disposal. As soon as we have new resources, we can do even better. Ericksonian thought holds that positive intentions exist at the source of all problems, negative experiences and habits of life (such as a behaviour, a way of thinking, a manner of speaking, a physical or mental symptom). The aim is neither to eliminate nor to judge these positive intentions but to find an alternative way to satisfy them, in a way that is more respectful towards ourselves and the people around us.

 

Hypnosis

Hypnosis, also called hypnotic trance, is a natural state of our consciousness that is situated between waking and sleeping. We experience this state daily when we are absorbed in reading a book, watching a film, when we daydream while staring at the ceiling, or daydream at the same time as being able to follow a discussion. 

 

If you have a driving licence, perhaps you have already experienced losing yourself in a daydream whilst driving.  Without thinking about driving you still managed to stay on the right route despite this. This can even happen to us when we are walking along a road. You have walked or driven unconsciously - in other words your eyes saw the road or path and your hands and feet guided you without your conscious mind or logical thought intervening. It was your subconscious mind that was acting - exactly the same mind that permits you to stand upright without thinking about your balance. During a moment of excellence or high performance, when we experience high concentration, relaxation and above all being in the present moment, we are actually in a sort of trance – and thereby better connected to our subconscious potential. Be this in sport, art or the practice of our profession: excellence, imagination and creativity are extremely important. Albert Einstein said that imagination is more important than knowledge. This holds true not only for scientific discovery, but also for when we want to reinvent our lives. Trance permits us to wake the creativity that lies dormant within us. It is with the explicit aim of activating the subconscious mind that we seek to induce this state of modified consciousness called hypnosis or trance, because it constitutes a state of learning. Our subconscious mind - the seat of our sensory perception, our emotions and our immune system – becomes very active as soon as the activity of our conscious mind – the seat of our rational and intellectual intelligence – diminishes. This state can also be called “super-consciousness”, because it permits a feeling of being more ‘oneself’ and allows us to see things with more distance and simplicity without being influenced by stress and worry.

 

See you soon, Philipp
results.name: Hypnotherapy and Coaching  for personal transformation

results.description:
Welcome to Züri eXpats Hike & Outdoor Sandbox!

 

Let's get into gear and see more of Switzerland. We know the best places and trails


Summer hikes all over Switzerland for all levels.


 

Rafting in the greatest canyons you will ever find.

 

 

Horse riding in the Montafon Valley national park.

 

 

Paragliding over the Alps like an eagle.

 

 


 

 

 

 

 

And Zurich offers quality of life that can’t be beat. It has a lake with pure, clear water surrounded by hills and is very close to many scenic mountains.

 

About the Züri eXpat Sandbox

Earlier this year, our parent Meetup group Züri eXpats grew by leaps and bounds, thanks to a motley crew of savvy social butterflies and oodles of volunteer help. As this group expanded and merged with another popular Meetup group, it chose to capitalize & focus on a winning formula for certain events and locations. This left our members without a creative outlet to experiment with their OWN event ideas.

Thus the Sandbox was developed, as an inspired and evolving entity BY & FOR our current Züri eXpats members.

 

We are alive and kicking... here is a summary of our activities.

This past year we organized a variety of professional, social, and cultural meetups, also planning numerous social gatherings around international highlights in Zurich. We did over 240 events in and around Zurich, and all over Switzerland.

Our highly qualified fellow expat Sandbox members will be there for:

◉ Runs along the lake, starting at Chinagarten: Exercise with your peers and enjoy life in Zurich.
◉ Bike around Lake/ Limmat river: The best places to bike are not obvious!
◉ Hike in the Canton of Zurich and in the surrounding mountains: We’ll show you the best trails and breathtaking views.
◉ Visit interesting objects in the Canton of ZH: Ladies , we give you a insight how to get all invitations to all great paces.
◉ Swim and sail around the lake: We offer possibilities to sail with us.

From basic to advanced, from general to sector related… Just bring an idea for an event!

We do a lot with our four Meetup groups: Züri eXpats City Life Network, Züri eXpats Business Professionals, Züri eXpats Hike & Outdoor Sandbox, and Zurich Movie Fans. Altogether we have over 3000 highly educated members that contribute to 60% of the economic output of the Canton of Zurich.

Züri eXpats also participates in social and semi-political events that help contribute awareness and promote integration of expats in Zurich. We contribute positively to the Swiss lifestyle as well, and work in cooperation with our partners in the integration offices at both the city and cantonal level.

We look forward to meeting you at one of our upcoming events, to attend and contribute to the experience…whether you are Swiss or an Ausländer.

 

Volunteers WANTED

We have ambitious plans including new activities & VIP venues for our members this year. It is our intention to have a full range of events throughout the week that cater to everyone's interests.

If you are interested in being part of the team that makes it all happen, you can be a volunteer. If you help us with five events, you will be a premium member for the year and belong to all four Züri eXpats platforms. If you are too busy, you can also show us your support with €20 per annum as a member of the four platforms.

Please sign up as volunteer today and don’t forget to RSVP for tonight's event!

We have an international staff of energetic and enthusiastic volunteers that will make you feel welcome at ALL of our events.

Our goal >> The Züri eXpats Sandbox strives to be a safe, welcoming and open platform for the creative exploration of new Meetup event ideas and formats, by and for our members. Grow your inner event planner! We'll provide you with feedback and guidance, and help foster your event ideas. We may even promote your event on our other social media platforms – Meetup, Facebook, LinkedIn, Xing, etc.

Here are some basic guidelines:

1) Become a member.

2) Shoot us a quick email on what type of event you'd like to create. We'll give you some constructive feedback (if needed) for quick changes and tips to improve your event concept.

3) Once we green-light your project, we'll make you an event host. This will allow you to immediately create your very own Meetup event in Sandbox.

4) By creating quality, recurring events with increasing numbers of attendees and positive feedback, we will lend our marketing muscle to your cause by cross-promoting your event(s) on our other social platforms – Meetup, Facebook, LinkedIn, Xing, etc. In addition, we could create "Züri eXpats co-branded marketing materials" such as flyers and banners, which will further grow your event ideas beyond what any one person could do on their own.

5) For those event planners that show promise, rest assured that we'll have our eyes on YOU! If you are up to the challenge, we may invite you to become one of our main group's planning committee members, which has its own perks and privileges :)

Please note: This group is an extension of our other Meetup group, Züri eXpats. You can sign up for this other group for updates on our regularly planned social events.

We look forward to helping you grow your ideas in the Sandbox in 2013 and beyond!


Sincerely,

John Wubbe

President of Züri eXpats

For those interested in organizing, or would like further information, please call 079 946 38 43 or jpmwubbe@gmail.com. You can contact me for advice, ideas, or suggestions.

Liebe Tantrikas!

Gerne begrüssen wir Euch zu unseren Treffen, um zusammen ein Stück unseres spirituellen Weges zu mehr Liebe und Bewusstsein zurückzulegen mit Meditation, tantrischen Ritualen, Mantrasingen, Tanzen, Lachen, Kuscheln und vielem mehr.

Komm und mach mit, öffne Dein Herz, lass die Liebe und Energie fliessen und erlebe einen erweiterten Bewusstseinszustand in einer Gruppe mit gleichgesinnten Menschen... die Möglichkeit, einen Raum zu schaffen, in dem jede/r sich selbst sein kann, ehrlich, authentisch, einfach so, wie er/sie ist, wie er/sie sein möchte, kann, darf, versucht, ausprobiert, weiterkommt - einfach im Fluss bleibt, mit offenem Herzen, ruhigem Geist und Harmonie in Körper und Seele.

Dieses Treffen ermöglicht es Dir, Dich selbst besser kennenzulernen, die Menschen in der Gruppe auf der Seelenebene zu treffen und herauszufinden, wie gross und weit und bunt und schillernd die spirituell tantrische Welt sein kann mit all ihren Facetten, sowohl ihren Schönheiten als auch ihren Herausforderungen. Wir laden Dich ein, Deinen inneren Reichtum zu entdecken, Liebe und Bewusstsein zu mehren und mit den anderen Menschen in der Gruppe zu teilen, sie an Deinen schönsten Gaben teilhaben zu lassen und Dich von ihnen mit ihren wundervollen Qualitäten beschenken zu lassen.

Die Treffen gestalten sich jedes Mal etwas anders, je nachdem, was gerade passt und möglich ist. Sie finden immer auf der Herzensebene statt, jede/r kann sich so weit öffnen, wie er/sie möchte und es entsteht immer ein Zauber, den man in den Alltag mitnimmt.

Sat Nam, Celestial Wings.

results.description:
Hola!!

My name is Vanessa. I decided to start this group because I'd like to meet people with the passion for food, as well as introducing my new friends to the joys of food without the guilt!! For me, a meal becomes an absolute pleasure when shared among friends and loved ones.

I was born in Lima, Peru and therefore my my background, knowledge and expertise will provide you with tips for a tasty Peruvian meal. But, its not only about Peru. Since I am also an American citizen and lived several years in New York, “The culture capital city" and the greatest "Melting Pot" in the world, I was blessed with the rich traditions of diverse and authentic ethnic foods and cultures.

While in New York, my hobbie was dinning in different restaurants, trying different kinds of international food, and learning how to cook a variety of dishes. From this experience, I believe that there are no limits when someone likes to cook. Any dish made with love results in a delicious meal! My family and friends can assure that;)

This group is all about ethnic foods, cooking, dining out as well as offering a rich cultural language experience. The hope is to also cultivate wonderful friendships.

So, if you are like me and can't stand being without tasty food and want to spend an evening indulging in amazing cuisine, wine and conversation, you should join this group. Looking forward to meet you!!!

results.description:
The Zurich Swiss Trail Club (STC) events will include Hikes, Via Ferrata events, Snowshoeing, Skiing and from time to time Biking. There will be events scheduled for various levels of fitness. Activities will be posted with levels of difficulty.

Previous Alpine experience with hiking, a Via Ferrata, snowshoeing and skiing will be required on most activities, as it applies.

Previous experience on group outings is required for all activities (outings with a few persons, or alone, are not the same as contributing to a group outing and dynamic).

Following standard hiking etiquette, for groups, is required on all hikes and snowshoe outings.

STANDARD HIKING ETIQUETTE FOR GROUPS

Managing groups on hikes can be challenging; therefore, standard hiking etiquette has been put into place to help make group activities more enjoyable for all. They apply to snowshoe hikes too.  The etiquette is commonly used within organizations such as the Swiss Alpine Club. A few simple rules make it much easier to hike with a group.

Please review the 'Hiking Etiquette' document on this link.

http://www.meetup.com/Zurich-Swiss-Trail-Club/pages/Hiking_Trail_Etiquette/

NO ONE IS LEFT BEHIND

These are GROUP OUTINGS. We do not want anyone:

• to be left behind, lost or to spend the day alone,
• to miss the beauty of the planned route,
• to find themselves in a dangerous situation,
• to find themselves on terrain which is more difficult than they prepared for.

We WANT everyone to have an enjoyable GROUP experience. Therefore, the following steps have been put into place:

• activities will be limited in number,
• co-leaders (sweeps) will be assigned to activities as required, and
• Standard Hiking & Biking Etiquette, for groups, will be put into practice (see below).

WHAT HAPPENS ON AN OUTING

• we will form a circle; introduce the leader and the sweep (co-leader)

• attendees will be asked to introduce themselves with their first name

• any required details for the activity (distance, terrain, conditions and/or getting there and back) will be given

• we will start and finish the activity together

• wear appropriate shoes or boots and layered clothing - once an outing has started it will usually continue in spite of the weather - be prepared for changes in the weather and for extreme conditions

• these are nature outings; therefore, plenty of water will be required as restaurants, kiosks and shops will be avoided where possible; on longer outings packed food is required

• periodic, short stops will be made to drink and put on or take off clothing dependent upon weather

• as there are generally no rest room facilities, bushes and rocks serve in their stead

• at about the midpoint of a longer outing a "snack/lunch stop" will be taken

• the leader may choose to change the duration of the outing or the route or the pace dependent upon weather or physical conditions of the group

• everyone is invited to have a coffee or a drink afterwards

• please take note of the 'No Show' policy found under Pages on this group

http://www.meetup.com/Zurich-Swiss-Trail-Club/pages/No_Show_Policy/

PARTICIPATION

• Membership is free
• The events are not designed for children under sixteen unless specified.
• No pets are allowed on the outings.
results.name: Zurich Swiss Trail Club (STC)

results.description: Dear active people, Fit & Fun Zurich is a group which combines afterwork fun sports with good food, drink or early party. In summer, we swim, hike or bike. In winter, we do group fitness together in a nice gym. After sports, we then eat or drink together at one of Zurich’s lovely eateries waiting for us to discover. The aim is to keep us all fit, while enjoying the best tasty food Zurich has to offer with a great company of like-minded sports and food enthusiasts! Enjoy, Cher
results.name: Fit & Fun Zurich

results.description:
We're the Swiss kayaking group, that aims to find something out on the water for everyone, for all ages, whether new to the sport or a seasoned white water kayaker.   The group is now one season old and we're excited to see so many people interested and hope that everyone can take an active part in developing it into a great resource for people to get out kayaking.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our meetups:

We run a kayak school in Interlaken on the beautiful Lake Brienz and run a whole range of courses and tours exploring the fantastic corners of Switzerland and beyond, including many events in Zurich, giving you the foundations to develop as an independent paddler.

We then hope that with this soild foundation and safety knowledge that people can then get out and meetup together exploiting the different rental possibilities.  People are welome to use the group and when aou have the necessary experience can become an event organiser yourselves.


Organising your own tours and other free tours:

  • If you have completed the Safety & Rescue certificate (FSRT) or equivalent: You're welcome to organise events & tours on the group for others with the safety & rescue training certificate or the intro safety & rescue training, keeping in line with the basic safety principles (document to be put in "Pages" section.
  • We will also run another Taster day in Zurich in the Spring and Summer for people to meetup and try it out in a relaxed environment.  The will be a small cost to cover equipment use, which can be paid through the group
  • If you are an intermediate paddler (3star skills or equivalent) you're also welcome to organise trips with other intermediate or improver paddlers, and from time to time I also go out for paddle in more committing areas, which I will also put on the group, that people can join.
  • Rental options in Switzerland: Also to be put in the "pages" section soon

 

 

 

 

 

 

Our tours & courses:

We then cprovide the courses necessary for you to get out and start on your own. If you^d like to do a specific course and there's no date then just write us a mail and we'll put something up for you.  Our courses include:

Beginners in the Sport (first few times in a kayak)

  • Intro courses and tours around Switzerland,
  • Intro safety and rescue

Improvers (towards BCU 2star skills)

  • Sea Kayak Camps abroad,
  • White Water Intro Courses,
  • BCU (British Canoe Union) Safety & Rescue Certificate FSRT,
  • BCU personal proficiency awards - 2star kayak and open canoe skills,
  • Rolling courses

Intermediates (towards BCU 3star skills)

  • Bad weather training,
  • Rough water kayak handling,
  • Surfing Skills,
  • Improver White Water courses,
  • 3star skills training and assessment  (sea, surf and white water),
  • Leadership and coaching qualifications.

Leaders and Coaches (BCU 4 & 5star leadership and skills)

  • If you have a coaching or leadership qualification or aspire to doing one, get in touch and we can see how we can support you.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Sea Kayaks & equipment for Sale::

We'll also be selling two or three of our sea kayaks this winter to make way for new boats so please get in touch if your interested.  More information to follow.
If you're also interested in getting your own kit, we recommend visiting Rene at seekajak.ch, Switzerland's specialist sea kayak store (based in Illnau Effretikon).  He really has the best kit and the widest selection and comes highly recommended.  Rene also rents equipment for those with Rescue training.

Thank you again for joining and I look forward to meeting you all soon out on the water,
Cheers,
Dave
079 906 0551
www.hightide.ch
results.name: Kayaking Switzerland: For paddlers and people wanting to try

results.description:
Toastmasters International is an educational organization organized for the purpose of helping members improve their communication, public speaking, and leadership skills. Through its thousands of member clubs, Toastmasters International offers a program of communication and leadership projects designed to help people learn the arts of speaking, listening, and thinking.

Zuriberg Toastmasters is a club within this organization meeting in the Blue Monkey restaurant (Stüssihofstatt 3, 8001 Zurich) every other Tuesday at 18:45.

You can find more details at www.zuribergtm.ch

The number of members and guests in each meeting is about 20 people, so much larger than appears on the meetup website. Come and discover for yourself!
results.name: Zuriberg Toastmasters Club

results.description: This is a group for anyone who enjoys knitting, crochet, or any other type of needle work. While having a cup of coffee or tea, we can exchange tips and tricks on our latest arts & crafts projects, or just chat... Anybody and all skill levels are welcome!
results.name: Knit and Purl in Wohlen AG

results.description: HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript are the ubiquitous tools for the web. Whether you're a web designer, a frontend engineer, a javascript developer, or a game developer looking to explore the web as a new platform. In this group we talk about HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Usability, Interaction Design and new technologies in the frontend area.
results.name: FrontendGeek

results.description:
Do you want to improve your language skills and meet new people?

Pardon Me? is for those wishing to get their language skills to the next level. People wishing to improve their English, German, Spanish or Italian conversation levels.

All nationalities are welcome, and your language level is not important - you will not be alone!

A group of open-minded internationals speaking modern languages. Language conversation practice and exchange - a great way to meet new people in the city, have a glass and a laugh and practice with native speakers and professional language teachers.

Meetups will be held in both Zurich and Pfaeffikon

topics.name: Teaching English as a Second Language

results.name: Pardon Me? Language Exchange - DE, EN, ES and IT

results.description:
Do you feel compelled to write? This group is mainly about writing together and also about talking about writing and writers, talk about books and blogs, etc. Also, if you read a lot, I suggest writing might be something for you.

Benefits of writing:

- Writing -on your own or in a group- allows an exploration of ourselves and the world or any element of it through our lenses or the lenses of a fictional character! This is why it can feel like a magical activity.

- It is a self-expressive activity and a very powerful source of all healing and clarity.

- Even in a group, it is an introspective activity which can work like a meditation!

- If we give a go to reading aloud for the others some of what you wrote, without getting any feedback, it can be quite liberating.

- If you are extremely passionate about it, and you keep at it, you could get published!

“I still encourage anyone who feels at all compelled to
write to do so. I just try to warn people who hope to get published that
publication is not all that it is cracked up to be. But writing is. Writing has
so much to give, so much to teach, so many surprises. That thing you had to
force yourself to do – the actual act of writing – turns out to be the best
part. It’s like discovering that while you thought you needed the tea ceremony
for the caffeine, what you really needed was the tea ceremony. The act of
writing turns out to be its own reward.”
—Anne Lamott, from Bird by Bird(from writingfromthesoul.net)

The language of this meet up group is English. We will do some writing exercises that might prove challenging but worth doing. I have several books on writing plus I'd like to do the exercises suggested by Jane Brunette in writingfromthesoul.net.

This group has a mix and range of approaches and motivations for writing. Most of us are non-native English speakers. Obviously writing is predominantly a lone activity. In this group we make an exception and share. All you need is the willingness to write and an open mind. Please note: We don't come to correct or judge each other. If you wish to have feedback this can be organized.
results.name: Zurich and Thalwil Writing Group

results.description:
Nonverbal communication is everywhere. How we communicate is a lot more important then what we say. 
This group is designed to give and share insights about how to use nonverbal communication effectively
- to become more charismatic
- to master conflicts
- to become a better communicator or Presentator
- to be seen as a confident person
- etc....
results.name: Body-Language and nonverbal communication

results.description:
Are you a diver or do you want to become one? Join this group to meet divers and wanna-be divers around Zürich. Let's get together to talk about diving, look at underwater pictures and video, get an idea where to plan your next holiday. Let's meet with people who have our same passion and exchange our experience!

Learn more about scuba diving around the world.
results.name: Divers in Zürich

results.description: This group is intended to be a community for all interested in self-realization, growth, and healing. As the great mystic G. Gurdjieff would say: "We are spiritual beings having a human experience, not human beings having a spiritual one."
results.name: Yoga, Meditation, and Healing Seminars

results.description: Do you have a curious approach to life and enjoy meeting new people? Do you like to learn, discuss, and participate in activities that support your personal growth, make you feel motivated and inspired, or simply bring a smile to your face? Then CURIOUS MINDS is a group for you. Everyone is welcome to join and to lead. So, if you have a topic you are curious about or want to organize an event, please send me an email before your spark goes away! “The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.” ― Eleanor Roosevelt
results.name: Curious Minds of Zurich

results.description:
This is a simple group for new people wanting to get into meditation. We will discuss brief subjects and follow a 30-40 min guided meditation. We will keep things simple, so don't be afraid to show in.

The aim of the group is to find a moment during the week to get together and dedicate 30-40 min to our self. While meditating you stop thoughts and enhance the connection with the inner you. Didn't it happened to you while walking or eating for example, you were doing something you were not conscious of? Like in automatic? Or you were completely absorbed by emotions, worries or problems? Maybe you let your self absorb completely by anger, fear?

The objective of meditation is to bring balance to your life and stop that unnecessary thoughts that doesn't let you sleep. Of course this is the first step, for the most experienced ones, meditation means an spiritual connection with all there is.


Come and join the group, even if you have no idea of what meditation is, or you are an experience practitioner, this is a moment of share and inner balance.


The Meditation session will be guided with different objectives: Balance your chakras, initiation on meditation, decision making, etc.
results.name: Meditation in Zurich

results.description: This group is designed for people who are interested in practicing Spanish language conversation skills and meeting new people. Of course, native Spanish speakers are more than welcome to join. Although meetups will be held mostly in cafes or restaurant/bars, we can also arrange meetups for other special events.
results.name: Grupo de Conversacion en Español de Zug

results.description:
Join, if you are interested in exploring the culinary delights that can be found in top notch restaurants. Think working off the *** places in the guide rouge michelin (or alike) no further than a weekend trip away from Zürich. If you are new to eating on this level of cooking-craft, don't worry about this possibly being a stiff or status driven affair. It is not. Caviar and champagne is not what this is about - and besides, you can have those everywhere in the world. This group is about is about finding and sharing the experiencing of the two spoonful of perfectly grilled fresh summer peas hidden in an otherwise splendid tasting menu that shift your perception of what you previously though possible in a kitchen. This group is about bringing together those people who do (or would) enjoy restaurant craft at the top level (more often) but lack the people around them who share this passion to do so (more often).

For the record, this group is not trying to replicate what is already very well covered by groups like

http://www.meetup.com/FOOD-AND-FRIENDS-ZURI...

http://www.meetup.com/Discover-restaurants-...

http://www.meetup.com/Dining-Out-Zurich/

but will try to go beyond what most people consider "reasonable effort" in terms of time, travel and money to achieve the indulgence.

If you consider this crazy, don't worry. It does not matter, as long as you like it.

Hence, this will never become a weekly meeting, which stands to reason if you actually are willing to travel to e.g. Alba in Piemonte over the weekend just to to have an outstanding meal. That said, there is no _need_ to travel afar if we find extraordinary places to eat closer to Zürich. Just check if one of the above zürich restaurant explorer groups might not be more fitting before making a suggestion here.

Now for the scope of what i had in mind, i have built a custom google maps entry with my suggestions, filled with some initial research into the locations, their tasting menues and ballpark pricings.

http://goo.gl/maps/zW...

I'd be happy to let people become co-organizers for meetups at these places or other top-drawer food places if you are inclined. Just let me know.
results.name: Zürich Gourmet Club -  The Top Notch Restaurant Explorer

results.description:
THIS GROUP IS NO LONGER ACTIVE 

Due to the duplication of the events with the meetup Arabs in Zurich , we have merged with that group and started organizing events mainly through them. 


I was hoping to start a meetup where Arabic speaking ladies can join the group either meetup sometimes for a playdate, family BBQ, and some other times a girly get together for us ladies to enjoy a nice meal, or a cup of tea or even a short walk!Another advantage of joining this group is supporting and helping new Arabic ladies in town, either by showing them around, explaining how things work here or even by the simplest form of support, enjoying a cup of tea with some one from back home.
results.name: Mediterranean Women in Zurich

Are you studying Italian?

The more, the merrier :-)

Don't you speak Italian (yet)?

Don't you worry: everybody is welcome and we'll get you up and running with the fundamentals of this beautiful  language in no time!

A presto.

Luca

results.description:
The worlds of journalists, designers and developers are coming together as reporting goes digital and Internet companies become media empires. Journalists call themselves "hacks," someone who can churn out words in any situation. Hackers use the digital equivalent of duct tape to whip out code. Designers and hacker-journalists work to bridge the two worlds.

Hacks/Hackers brings all these people together — those who are working to help people make sense of their world. It's for journalists, developers and designers exploring technologies to filter and visualize information, and for those who use technology to find and tell stories.

In the age of information overload, all their work has become even more crucial. This group aims to help members find inspiration and think in new directions, bringing together potential collaborators for projects and new ventures.

Please also check out our blog at HacksHackers.com or talk with us on Twitter at @HacksHackersZRH. Help us build the future of news and civic information!
results.name: Hacks/Hackers Zürich

results.description:
Hallo zusammen,

Nachdem es nun auch einen Treffpunkt Philosophie in Zürich gibt, freuen wir uns, wenn ihr bei unserer Gruppe dabei seit. Was machen wir? Neben Vorträgen, Kursen und Discussionsgruppen, möchten wir der PRAKTISCHEN Philosophie in Zürich mehr Raum zu geben. Es geht uns um die wesentlichen Fragen des Lebens. So spannen wir im „Treffpunkt Philosophie“ die Brücke zwischen uralten Weisheitslehren und der aktuellen Situation unserer Welt. Denn nur durch den Bezug zur Aktualität, bleibt die Philosophie einfach, praktisch und lebensnahe.

Nähere Infos zu unseren Veranstaltungen und zum Kurs "Abenteuer Philosophie" erhaltet ihr unter:

www.treffpunkt-philosophie.ch
results.name: Treffpunkt Philosophie

results.description:
The Unity 3D user group Zurich is intended to be a social experience, allowing Unity users to connect with fellow developers, either to share experiences or to inspire new collaborative partnerships.

It is designed to be accessible for all Unity users with advice for both beginners and experienced users. We're also aiming to provide inspiration for all.
results.name: Zurich Unity 3D User Group

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in photography. From novice to expert. From nature to urban. From fasion to whatever. From locals to exotics. I am looking forward to shoot together.
results.name: Lucerne Photography Group

results.description: This is an IBM sponsored Big Data meetup group.� Geared towards developers, data scientists and ALL Big Data enthusiasts, our meetups provide an opportunity to work hands on with the solutions and tools in our Big Data portfolio. Our Meetups typically include a 45-60 min (max) presentation that serves as an introduction and overview for a specific Big Data technology.� It is followed by ~3 hours to collaborate with fellow developers and apply your Big Data skills.� We provide a cloud environment that you can run through the browser of your laptop at NO cost to you.� Our meetups are FREE. Meetup topics include: - Hadoop-based analytics - Stream Computing - Text Analytics - Visualization and Discovery tools for Big Data - Big Data App Development - Deep dives into the technologies that makes big data processing possible - Anything and everything about Big Data Join us today for a hands on software development experience.

results.description:
Salons are places people go to talk about ideas and issues one-step removed from politics and point scoring. They are spaces where disagreement and proper discussion are encouraged. Top speakers give up their time for free and they speak only for five to seven minutes each. Then discussion opens up. For full details and tickets:

http://www.zurichsalon.org/

results.description: A group for informal and in-depth discussion about improving the world of work and product development meeting occasionally over lunch. What will we discuss? That’s up to you. We’re all about enhancing collaboration inside organisations. You create the agenda and allow the most important themes to emerge. We’ll use the Lean Coffee format (over lunch) which means you will propose the topics for discussion. With all the topics on the table, everyone will vote to prioritise the agenda according to interest and value. We are beginners, experienced practitioners, coaches, PM office workers, product owners, managers and curious folk outside of traditional IT.
results.name: Lean Agile Lunch Zurich

results.description:
ABOUT US

Now Canada's largest tech meetups, and growing internationally, eh.

RSVP to get a nametag. This is important, because people without nametags aren't even really people. There, we said it. :) Check us out >>> Facebook | Twitter

HackerNest is an international nonprofit community movement focused on building supportive Silicon Valley like tech communities in every city - strengthening local tech ecosystems globally through unpretentious social events and hackathons. We’re nurturing cohesive communities today to empower them with more relevant and accessible peer-based tech education tomorrow.

Connecting people is awesome. And community good breeds fab karma.

We cram smart, accomplished people into a room with free beer. Our relaxed, down-to-earth Tech Socials are now Canada’s largest tech meetups.

Our membership - diverse and highly technical. Developers, designers, engineers, social media/business folk, entrepreneurs, investors, etc. regularly gather to socialize, talk tech, maybe hear speakers or watch demos, and meet future co-founders, employees, funders, and friends. Strict no-douchebag policy.

Global. We want an international network of HackerNest “splinter cells” to pop up everywhere – from underserved cities to high-growth innovation centers – to rescue nerds from isolated basements, offices, and code tunnel vision.

We love hardcore nerdcore. Tech folks, tech events, tech love. Our formula: laid back atmosphere + free drinks + brilliant people = fireworks

We're not scienticians, but the formula seems to work: we became Canada's largest tech meetups in a year, before even leaving Toronto. Today we have "splinter cells" in multiple cities internationally.

Our goal is to complement and strengthen existing nerd ecosystems – we come in peace. This isn't a business; nobody owns HackerNest. Conceptually, it is the ideal of a strong and supportive tech community - pretty much anyone that isn't a jerk can be a part of it.

Interested in running HackerNest in your city? Take a look at the FAQ.

---->---

Whoa, longest descriptions evaaar. Need more? Here's some answers. Don't forget to check us out >>> Facebook | Twitter

---->---

Here's more pictures of our Tech Socials and hackathons:

********

When: Pretty darned regularly. Check back!

Format: Relaxed. Hang, talk tech, occasionally a speaker, plot to take over the world, etc.

Where: Usually in the large private office of a tech company (have a venue?)

 

At any given HackerNest meetup, you may find people who are:

developing incredibly snazzy Ruby (most likely on Rails) applications - heady hardcore designer typesPHP/Perl/.NET/Python/django addicts - ...Fortran devs?! - looking for a tech/entrepreneur/new business story to cover - Objective-C experts and iPhone/iPad/Apple product pundits - engineers and managers and CTOs looking for co-founders to join their angel/VC-backed tech startup - looking to write articles/stories about the obscure/interesting/hilarious hacks you've pulled off - totally oblivious and just wandered in because they heard there was booze (!?) - building a top-secret app out of their basement that's going to change the way the world does X; like "Facebook for Squirrels" - scrambling to find a partner to work with on a well-paying contract that's just a wee bit too much workload for the anticipated deadline - heroes, because they're part of the burgeoning community that will reverse all this insane brain-drain - incredibly talented, smart, entrepreneurial go-getters who are absolutely dangerous to the status quo - pretty bloody interesting, because seriously, if they're coming out for drinks ON A MONDAY (or Tuesday, or Wednesday) NIGHT... they've gotta be

 

Chances are, you'll fit right in if you're a(n):

software or hardware hacker/h4ck3r (or maybe just a hack)

coder/developer/programmer/brogrammerdesigner, UX-oriented, or just like making things pretty

biotech/electrical/computer or basically any kind of engineer

network/network/system/IT administrator

front/back-end specialist

angel investor

demon investor

venture capitalist

venture communist

tech enthusiast

tech/entrepreneur-oriented media/journalist

OCD blogger/Tweeter

bloodthirsty recruiter looking to poach developers

internet mogul

nerd/geek/freak/tweak

entrepreneur

SEO/SEM pro

writer/project manager/business analyst

1337 individual

etc., etc.

...and aren't a douchebag. <3
results.name: HackerNest Zürich Tech Socials

results.description:
Hi, I'm Reena, a self-confessed foodie, and founder of Spice Lounge Supper Club, Zurich's first Supper Club for fine spicy cuisine.

I grew up in India where I learnt to cook a great variety of Indian regional food. I've also had the pleasure of preparing and enjoying popular spicy cuisines of the world from travel and living in the culinary melting pot of London for over 7 years :-)

I've lived in Zurich for over eight years and love it here, it's a wonderful place with little to complain about. However, as a lover of spicy food, eating out in Zurich has left me a little disappointed. This encouraged me to start Spice Lounge Supper Club. Naturally, Indian regional cuisine features heavily but I also love preparing authentic spice rich cuisines from many other countries.

Spice Lounge is first and foremost about authentic and delicious spicy food, but is also a great opportunity to meet new people in a small group for quality conversation while enjoying great food.

If you enjoy authentic spicy food, you should join Spice Lounge Supper Club !
results.name: Spice Lounge Supper Club

results.description: Was ist die Starter Lounge? Eine Plattform für Selbständige, Unternehmer, Ideenumsetzer und solche die es werden wollen. Ob eine neue Bio-Marmelade, vegane Hundekuchen oder eine neue Website für Immobilienmakler. Lass uns deine Ideen mit der Realität verbinden und praxisorientiert umzusetzen. Wieso ist das wichtig? Wenn dein Umfeld deine Ideen nicht versteht oder nicht weiterhelfen kann, solltest du eine Anlaufstelle haben, um neue Inputs zu holen. Die Starterlounge gibt dir das Umfeld, die es möglich wird. Gemeinsam ist es einfacher. Starter Lounge@Starbucks-Stauffacher Für den Anlass bekommen wir eine geniale Lounge: der 1. Stock im Starbucks Stauffacher. Es hat bequeme Sofas, Internetanschluss und eine gemütliches Ambiente. Das perfekte Umfeld für einen inspirierenden Abend.
results.name: Inspirationsabend in der StarterLounge@Starbucks Stauffacher

results.description:
WeD are a mixed group between 25 and 45 years old who play volleyball once a week. Are you interested? If you have played volleyball before that's even better, but not mandatory. Just drop by and have a look. During the summer time we play beach Volleyball

When/where:
Tuesday 19:30 – 21.30, indoor court 2, Sportplatz Letzi, Espenhofweg, Zürich
(Bus Nr. 72 stop Schulhaus Altweg, near Triemli).

During school holidays the indoor courts are closed and there is no volleyball
results.name: Volleytriemli

results.description:
Do you find it difficult to have a great cup of coffee in Zurich? Isn't it shame that such a wonderful city has so little to offer when it comes to high quality coffee (let alone speciality coffee!) compared to London, Berlin, New York or Tokyo. Yet, there are people who deeply care about coffee and this group aims to bring them (yes, that's you!) together.

Join this group if you have an inquisitive mind, have at least one coffee per day and want to:

  • Share your passion for coffee with like-minded people
  • Taste different varieties of coffee from all around the world (and learn what the differences are)
  • Participate in workshops teaching you how to make perfect coffee at home - Watch and share interesting presentations / movies / documentaries about coffee
  • Learn from coffee experts about different aspects of coffee production
  • Meet coffee owners / baristas / roaster and get insights about their daily work Are you interested in any of these?

This group will be a platform allowing us to talk, discuss and learn about coffee. Join us! You'll never look at coffee the same way again.
results.name: Coffee Club Zurich

results.description: This is a social group for both chinese speaking or none chinese speaking. If you love learning more about the chinese culture or want to practice your chinese or just want to meet other Chinese speaking people like yourself come and join us. Let's get together for social activities and plan great events while making new friends!
results.name: Chinese Social Group

results.description:
Hola a todos! Muchos de ustedes ya saben que Judith se fue a vivir a Berlin y me ha dejado como la actual organizadora del grupo, y quería presentarme.

En lo profesional, soy Psicologa laboral e Instructora de Hatha-Yoga, con especialización en técnicas Iyengar y en Yoga para Niños. Tengo 10 años de experiencia en la enseñanza del Yoga y estoy certificada por la Yoga Alliance International Europe como Master Yoga Teacher de 500 h. He trabajado en el area de Recursos Humanos, en donde he aplicado mis conocimientos del Yoga en las empresas, principalmente en el tema de manejo de estrés.

En mis clases de Hatha-Yoga suelo incorporar varios elementos de la metodología Iyengar. Mi objetivo es que cada uno de mis alumnos vaya avanzando a distintos niveles, sistemáticamente, pero en armonía con su ritmo personal.

A algunas de ustedes las conocí en la cena Canadiense... mujeres abiertas, con opiniones claras y que les gusta disfrutar, espero que podamos hacer crecer esa energía, junto al resto de mis alumnas y amigas en Suiza.

Seguimos con clases en horarios y lugares de práctica con buena energía y cercanos a los ya acostumbrados. Hemos mantenido los precios y hay descuentos. Si hay alguien que desea practicar y tiene problemas económicos puede conversarlo conmigo.

Horarios y lugares:

- Martes 19:30-20:45 hrs. Inicio: 28 Abril. Eggbühlstrasse 20 (Kreis 11, Oerlikon). En Español.

- Miércoles de 19:00-20:15 hrs. Inicio: 29 Abril. Zentralstrasse 140 (Kreis 3, Wiedikon). En Español y Aleman.

- Jueves 19:30-20:45 hrs. Inicio: 30 Abril. Eggbühlstrasse 20 (Kreis 11, Oerlikon). En Español.
